articles.title: How Twitter Users Reacted to Removal of Legacy Blue
articles.description: Twitter's legacy blue ticks are vanishing from high-profile users' accounts, including those of Beyoncé, Pope Francis, and Donald Trump. The social media platform owned by Elon Musk has introduced a monthly fee for users to keep their blue verification checkmarks. Find out more about the costs and the implications for journalists, athletes, public figures, and other celebrity users
articles.content:
Elon Musk’s latest move to abolish what he termed as the “lords and peasants" system on Twitter by removing the legacy blue tick has stirred up a storm of mixed reactions from netizens worldwide.

articles.author: News18
articles.title: Why Did Twitter's Legacy Blue Ticks Vanish? EXPLAINED
articles.description: Twitter removes blue ticks from high-profile accounts, including those of the Pope, Donald Trump, and Justin Bieber. Elon Musk, the owner, had earlier pledged to get rid of the "lords & peasants system" and sell the blue badge for $8 a month. However, US Senator Brian Schatz and others have raised concerns about the impact of the removals on public confidence during natural disasters.
articles.content:
On April 20, Twitter began removing its blue verification checkmarks from user accounts, including those belonging to high-profile figures such as Donald Trump, Oprah Winfrey and the Pope.
